reference: https://node-libcurl-docs.netlify.app/interfaces/_lib_generated_curloption_.curloption.html

followLocation.description:
follow HTTP 3xx redirects. Defaults to 0, disabled

Defaults to true

Reference: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION.html

httpVersion.description:
HTTP protocol version to use. Defaults to V2_0_Tls

Reference: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION.html

maxRedirects.description:
maximum number of redirects allowed. Defaults to -1, unlimited

Defaults to -1

Reference: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS.html

origin.description: set in header. Defaults to null

rejectUnauthorized.description:
If not false a server automatically reject clients with invalid certificates

Defaults to false

requestTimeout.description:
maximum time the transfer is allowed to complete Default timeout is 0 (zero) which means it never times out during transfer.

default: 0

Reference: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_TIMEOUT_MS.html

userAgent.description:
HTTP user-agent header. Defaults to 'Firecamp_${app_version}'

Reference: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_USERAGENT.html

restConfig.description: Allow to configure http request Supported in desktop app only

raw.description: represents the raw string of the request URL

queryParams.description: firecamp url specific query param doc: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/Identifying_resources_on_the_Web#query

pathParams.description: Path parameters are variable parts of a URL path. They are typically used to point to a specific resource within a collection, such as a user identified by ID. A URL can have several path parameters, each denoted by preceding ':'

reconnect.description: reconnect on socket connection break. Defaults to false

reconnectAttempts.description: how many time reconnect attempts perform. Defaults to 3

reconnectTimeout.description: delay between each reconnect attempt. Defaults to 3000

rejectUnauthorized.description: If not false a server automatically reject clients with invalid certificates Defaults to false

followRedirects.description: Whether or not to follow redirects. Defaults to false.

handshakeTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the handshake request. This is reset after every redirection.

maxRedirects.description: The maximum number of redirects allowed. Defaults to 10.

protocolVersion.description: Value of the Sec-WebSocket-Version header. Defaults to 13

origin.description: Value of the Origin or Sec-WebSocket-Origin header depending on the protocolVersion.

maxPayload.description: The maximum allowed message size in bytes.

isDefault.description: whether connection is default or not note: key exist only in default connection

ping.description: whether to start sending ping event on connection open or not Defaults to false

folderId.description:
represents the unique identity of the item

here using following lib: https://www.npmjs.com/package/nanoid

version.description: socket.io client version. Defaults to v3

rejectUnauthorized.description: If not false a server automatically reject clients with invalid certificates Defaults to false

timeout.description: delay between each reconnect attempt. Defaults to 3000

reconnection.description: reconnect on socket connection break. Defaults to false

reconnectionAttempts.description: number of reconnection attempts before giving up. Defaults to 3

reconnectionDelay.description: how long to initially wait before attempting a new reconnection.  Defaults to 1000

reconnectionDelayMax.description: maximum amount of time to wait between re-connection.  Defaults to 5000

onConnectListeners.description: events start listening on connection open

isDefault.description: whether connection is default or not note: key exist only in default connection

forceNew.description: whether to reuse an existing connection. Defaults to false

namespace.description: communication channel that allows you to split the logic of your application over a single shared connection. #reference https://socket.io/docs/v2/namespaces/

path.description: name of the path that is captured on the server side. Defaults to '/socket.io'

ping.description: whether to start sending ping event on connection open or not Defaults to false

transports.description: a list of transports to try (in order). Engine always attempts to connect directly with the first one, provided the feature detection test for it passes.

auth.description: connection wise auth list. support in client version >= 3
